intro: Ervatamia calycina, commonly known as the desert lily, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are adapted to arid environments. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in early spring. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to store water and nutrients efficiently. Ervatamia calycina is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun, making it well-suited for xeriscaping.
